column18: I received invoice #1087 for April and the total shows €450 but my monthly membership plan...

column4: Board room booking for 15 people – 20 June

I'll be in Budapest for a week on business and I'm wondering if you offer day passes...

column4: LIMITED TIME OFFER – Click here now!!!
column18: Dear Friend CONGRATULATIONS You have been selected as a WINNER of our exclusive prize draw...

column4: Internet has been down for 3 hours
column18: This is ridiculous. The WiFi has been completely down since 9am and it's now noon...

column4: Oh great – the wifi is down again
column18: Oh wonderful the WiFi is down again for the third time this week. Brilliant management...

column3: Date and time the email was processed, in script timezone
Gmail thread ID (unique per conversation thread)
Gmail message ID (unique per individual message)
Sender display name and email address
Primary triage category: BILLING | BOOKING | COMPLAINT | INFO_REQUEST | MEMBERSHIP | SPAM
Confidence score 0–1. Scores ≥ 0.8 trigger auto-draft replies.
Secondary category if a second category also scored above threshold (may be empty)
Yes if sender is in VIP email or domain list, No otherwise
Yes if sentiment < −0.4 or category = COMPLAINT
Yes if sarcasm heuristic triggered (confidence reduced by 0.1)
Yes if an auto-draft reply was created in Gmail
Comma-separated list of Gmail labels applied to the thread
Word count of the plain-text email body
First 300 characters of the plain-text body (HTML stripped)
